Account Name: Bucom International
 Contact Name: Andreas Krammer

 Contact Email: akrammer@bucom.com
 User ID: dk89
 Case Origin: Phone
 Event Name: GO28667 MURANO CLL Study Investigator Meeting - Copenhagen
 Event ID: GO2810E
 Web Address: https://www.SignUp4.net/Public/ap.aspx?EID=GO2810E
 
  
 
 1. Go into Travel Dashboard
 
 2. Find the event, GO28667 MURANO CLL Study Investigator Meeting - Copenhagen and Click on Upload PNRs
 
 
 3. Download the sample spreadsheet and fill it out
 
 4. Upload the file and map the fields
 
 5. Go into the Attendee's record (Blandt, Marquax) and click on itinerary. The pnrs are all in am time now.
 
 
 
 Attached is the spreadsheet I uploaded

events.s:
Error appears to occur between the mapper and PNR. The uploaded times will display in their correct PM designation on the mapping screen, but once mapped, revert to the AM time in the PNR record.

I have heard that this is possibly a known issue. If that is the case, we do have the ability to amend the Manual PNR, but are there any other workaround options available?

•	Middle Name
•	Last Name
•	Specialty
•	NPI #
•	License, State

20919.title: SMS: Vendor Import: Creates a New Vendor Type without checking to see if that Vendor type already exists

events.s:
SMS: Vendor Import: Creates a New Vendor Type without checking to see if that Vendor type already exists


When I imported the Vendor Data, I had set up the Vendor Types and noted each Vendor as one of the current vendor types.  When I imported, it created a new, duplicate Vendor types for each vendor that had something in the Vendor Column.   

Example: Kiewit

Kiewit Corporation (KIEW10S) | KIEWIT (KIEW10F)
events.sHtml:

When I imported the Vendor Data, I had set up the Vendor Types and noted each Vendor as one of the current vendor types.  When I imported, it created a new, duplicate Vendor types for each vendor that had something in the Vendor Column. 

Example: Kiewit

Kiewit Corporation (KIEW10S) | KIEWIT (KIEW10F)

events.s:
this is feasible.  i put together a mockup using the old menu header as a drop in replacement for the new one, it requires a couple targeted css fixes, but other than that it should be fairly simple.
 
 To fully implement this, the swap would have to be performed in the code behind, and would have to be triggered off of some saved data somewhere (probably a new setting).

SMS MR18 (05-07-2014).title: IE11 BYO Report Wizard rendering anomaly.

events.s:
IE11 BYO Report Wizard rendering anomaly.
"To Right" and "To Left" buttons do not render as expected on IE11. This is consistent for all Budget Item fields in the wizard.

This doesn't seem to be related to Browser Doc mode. Moreover, seems to be the way IE11 is rendering the button bitmap. The buttons still work as expected...
events.sHtml:
IE11 BYO Report Wizard rendering anomaly.
"To Right" and "To Left" buttons do not render as expected on IE11. This is consistent for all Budget Item fields in the wizard.

This doesn't seem to be related to Browser Doc mode. Moreover, seems to be the way IE11 is rendering the button bitmap. The buttons still work as expected...

SMS MR18 (05-07-2014).title: SMS-Rapid Report- the "Checks" disappears when the Scroll bar is moved to right:

events.s:
Rapid Report- the "Checks" disappears when the Scroll bar is moved to right: on Rapid Reports with many Columns.

Steps:
1. Run Rapid Report (IE list below)
2. Right click--> first Column , like Meeting Name and view Columns turned on ( shows a check box)
3. Next Move Scroll "at bottom of grid to right 
4. Repeat step 2. 


1. BYO
2. Monthly Meeting Report 
3. Monthly Spend
4. Spend By Meeting Type  

See Attachment
